author: T. Pell

review: Most of the negative reviews I have seen are people that are angry about some functionality that they expected to exist that doesn't (ex. Someone gave Fire TV a 1 star because they weren't happy with the sling TV app) or what sounds to be user error.The fire stick is great.  I've had it for many months now and the family loves it.  I'd recommend, if you get it, that you have at least 2 services to streams.  Amazon prime and Netflix, for example.  Prime and Hulu.  Otherwise, you may be displeased with lack of choices.The device itself is fast, responsive, intuitive.  You can download a fire TV app for IOS and android devices that allows you to do voice search.  You can let pandora stream in the background while you have photos streaming on screen with no performance issues.  For the price, the device works great.  I'd give a 5 star rating if Amazon simply made the remote a fully functional game controller as well.  There's little reason why the couldn't do this other than to make you purchase another device (which arguably makes revenue sense). That said myself, nor anyone in my family, is going to buy the separate game controller.  As a result, we are not going to purchase any games that require the controller.  For us, if the remote doubled as a fully functional game controller, Amazon would be making more money off us.  Don't misunderstand me, there are games that can be played with the standard remote, they are limited however.  Some games can only be played with the designated game controller.
